Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: AngelaDimit
Reviews.Content: Last thursday till monday we stayed in this hotel for four nights. We booked a double room, as we came in we got a superior room. Nice big room at the ground floor in the garden, it looked the perfect room, but...... becouse of the nice weather the first evening there were a group of guests in the garden speaking, laughing and screaming very loud until deep in the night, bye bye night rest! Our room was also right next to the breakfast room so early in the morning around 6 o clock the staff was preparing breakfast, that was a lot of noise through the thin walls... so our first night was not so good. the following morning we asked another room who was quiet, that was no problem, there was only a double room available, but no problem for us if we could get a normal sleep! The room was clean and comfy and the rests of the nights we sleep very well. The breakfast was not included in our room and pretty expensive, 10 euro per person, one morning we eat breakfast in the hotel, despite the costs the food was good, loved the fresh pineapple! But... a one minute walk from the hotel (direction of the metro) there is a nice spot where you can buy your breakfast, fresh croissants, and a lot of choices in sandwiches, they were soooo nice, also cheap, 11 euro for 2 sandwiches and 2 fresh orange juice, take it to your room and enjoy breakfast at your balcony. The hotel is near the Blue metro line, 2 minutes walk, yes in the evening there are prostitues working across the street, and at the gas station, but they never bother you. The hotel has also a hotel bar/restaurant were they serve nice red wine! Overall good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wickedwitchStaffs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern, giant size beds and very clean. Near to the Marconi Metro just 4 stops from the Colloseum. Staff very friendly and receptoion staff spoke English which was a big help as our Italian was very poor! Shame there was no resturants close by. Breakfast was worth the 10 euros. We would have given this hotel 5 out of 5 but not enough choice on the menu for an evening meal. But overall would recommend this hotel and would defenitly use it again. It is on a busy main road that leads into the city but rooms have really good sound proofing and we did'nt hear any traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RRCNewYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new. The decoration, bathrooms, restaurant and gym are of high quality-- not easy too find in most European capitals especially for the price. Highly recommended to anyone heading to Rome. The only disadvantage is that it is away from the city center but there is a metro stop two blocks away. It is worth the distance.

Reviews.Title: “A good place for the EUR area”
Reviews.Author: Goguca
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel while attending business meetings in the EUR area. The big advantage over other hotels in that area is that this one is 2 blocks away from Marconi metro station linking you with Central Rome in 15 minutes. There is no reason to stay here if you visit Rome as a tourist unless you find such good fares that the commuting justifies being in the middle of nowhere. The hotel looks modern, with a nice bar/lounge in the reception area and a good breakfast every morning. Rooms are fine but not very spacious (and I had a deluxe one on the top floor). The room had access to a huge terrace, though. Only issue with management was how warm the room was. They refused to switch on the A/C as officially this was still cold weather for many. If I need to come back to the EUR area, I would prefer to stay in a more central location. That's where you can use your spare time and where social events will take place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good breakfast, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bventuri
Reviews.Content: First time i stay far from the city center, and this hotel made it worth. The hotel is modern, stylish, clean, very near from the metro with an amazing breakfast, not included in the price. the wi-fi is free and fast. Loved the hotel and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business trip on the Rome's EUR area”
Reviews.Author: RaffaeleB
Reviews.Content: Comfortable small hotel in the EUR area in Rome. I spent two nights at the Pulitzer and I have found everything I needed for my business trip. Large bed, nice breakfast, very clean, free internet connection and very comfortable lounge area to stay once back from work. All this for 90 pounds... sounds like a bargain for me ;)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel just for business, bad position.”
Reviews.Author: orso77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and well designed. People are really friendly and kind. Rooms and common places are really clean and confortable. The position is awful, there is nothing interesting around the hotel. There is a free wifi connection but in my room the signal was poor. During my last morning the water in the shower was cold. The price was good! Raccomended just for business not for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Roccoandhisbrothers
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel nearby Marconi subway station (line B), if you have to meet people either in downtown or EUR business area. I've been there just for 1 night and it is OK; room are not too large compare others 4 stars in Rome, quite, confortable and clean. I had last fllor room with terrace and bathroom was up one level compare the room. Nice view from terrace. Breakfast choice is ok, even if I was expecting less "packaged snack" and more home made food. Staff is friendly, lobby it's very narrow as well as reception area. It's an additional alternative if you need to stay southern Rome or EUR area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: zach006
Reviews.Content: Located between city centre and airport, this is a small stylish hotel with descent room sizes (superior) with balcony and modern design. Excellent breakfast and descent restaurant facilitites, food served in a nice lounge that also serves as bar and library. Ideal for business travellers. Friendly and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk unwilling to assist.”
Reviews.Author: Mbk300
Reviews.Content: Front desk unwilling to accomadate us and move our room to the rear of the hotel away from the the loud street.

Reviews.Title: “hotel value for money”
Reviews.Author: ikaria-sunset
Reviews.Content: Pulitzer is a 4 star hotel with nice lobby and dining room,,beautifully designed clean and comfortable room and bathroom.the room has a balcony. Rich and delicious breakfast. 2 laptops in the lobby,,Luggage Storage.The staff was kind,The location was safe and 2 minutes from metro line B (marconi station), 2 restaurants near by,where we have lunch and we like it insalata ricca.at Via Francesco Acri 50 Al Peperoncino at Via Ostiense , 369/375 get directions from google and get with the locals

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: Dan81nz
Reviews.Content: The hotel, while a bit out of the city centre is right near the Marconi metro station. Facilities within the hotel are very good, particularly the bar/restaurant - we had dinner there several times as it was very nice and well priced. The only downside was that there are not really any shops around the area

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Good value, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Shik06
Reviews.Content: I read so many reviews about this hotel before booking. There are so many mixed reviews, I was a little scared what to expect. Nevertheless my experience was very good with the hotel. I booked a surprise cake and flower bouquet to be delivered at 12 midnight. Umberto on reception helped me arrange all that. He is a very helpful, nice person and delight to deal with. I booked a taxi with hotel to pick us up from the airport, our flight was 15 minutes delayed and also landed on a different terminal. It took us 40 mins and 2 phones calls to hotel to finally find our driver and cab. Check In - Quick easy and friendly. Room - Clean, nice little balcony, modern, sky HD box but no English channels. Breakfast - we only took the breakfast once, eggs were cold, fruits were dry and canned, Orange juice tasted sour. avoid breakfast and go into some nice cafe. Peppy's bar near Bernini Station has awesome snacks, tea, coffee. We went there twice just for their vast selection of pastries :) Room Service- We ordered dinner on our first day, again a terrible mistake. There is Convent Restaurant walking distance from the hotel. Ask directions at the desk. The food, house wine were very good, very home like ambiance too. Location - 3-4 mins walk to train station. well lit and busy street so quiet safe. Just beware of the pick pockets on the tubes. All in all a very comfortable hotel, just avoid their food! try and liaise with Umberto if you want taxi, to & fro airport, or any special requirements. A very good hotel, will definitely stay there again if we ever go back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Design, Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: LeDrogman
Reviews.Content: the rooms are beautifully and tastefully designed, but it has an off-centre location which is a minus, bathrooms are small and uncomfortable, but generally the rooms are big in comparison to standard hotels in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Confortable, good value and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Nanda_BR
Reviews.Content: What do you expect when you pay 80 euro a night to stay in one of the top destinations of the world? A decent room but not much else as there's a price for everything and I think people who vote this place down DO NOT take into account how much they paid for (it seems that is something very common on these review websites). The Pulitzer is located 2 minutes walk from a metro station that takes you to the heart of Rome in 15 minutes. The metro costs 1 euro per trip, so not bad at all. The hotel is located in a very quiet middle class neighborhood, it is not a dangeraus place, but not very lively. We saw the prostitutes other reviers mentioned once at a gas station, but they minded their own business and kept at the back at the station waiting for their clientele. There were posters all over the street where you could see the local community was mobilizing to have them out of there, so there is a debate going on. They did not bother us at all. The hotel itself is very stylish, confortable, beds were great, air conditioner very good, sky with italian and international channels, bathroom was good too and the furniture itself is all new. Staff was friendly at all times and the BREAKFAST was delicious with plenty of variety, it was definitely one of the highlights of our day. Plus, they have wi-fi throughout for free. I would never have this kind of confort for this price had I chosen to stay in the heart of Rome. I would recommed this a 100% for those who do not mind the 20 minute trip to the city but value some confort, a good night sleep and a great breakfast for a VERY reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights as a base going into Rome for the sights. The metro ride is very easy into Rome - we spent a lot of time around Colosso (colosseum) which is on the same line. Our flight into Leonardo Da Vinci/ Fiumicino was delayed, and we hadn't researched public transport very well. We took the Leonardo Express to Termini, to find the Metro had finished so took a taxi - the driver told us it would have been cheaper to get the taxi direct from the airport. We picked this hotel in part because it had a private bathroom (I have a medical condition) which was great. The room was comfortable and we were able to spend time there when the heat outside was too much. Breakfast was also really good. There is an excellent restaurant just around the corner (interesting walk down a slip road if you have no car). There are prostitutes in the area at night, although we had no problems. If you have children who are inquistive you want to consider this.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!! Prostitutes all down the avenue!”
Reviews.Author: tbtrw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pulitzer for 5 nights. This hotel is NOT convenient for tourism. While it is true it is close to the metro. You have several stops before any attractions and the metro is packed, dirty, not air conditioned and graffiti. The price is still steep for the location and the room wasn't much better than a Marriott at home. Pictures on website are a bit deceiving. The problem came when we came back to the hotel every night between 10:30 and 11pm. THERE ARE PROSTITUTES ALL UP AND DOWN THE AVENUE!!! SO as you are walking back from the metro to your hotel you are bombarded by women with bras showing and butt cheeks hanging out. I was horrified and immediately felt unsafe. There are no security measures in the hotel and often at night front desk person is hanging out in the back chatting! Anybody can come in or out, and you do not need a card to go up or down the elevators. Stay somewhere else close to the tourist attractions, even if it is older and rooms are not as nice. OR spend a little more. Whatever you do.... this hotel is not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel & fantastic local restaurant close by”
Reviews.Author: Nana81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit outside the city centre but easy to reach by Metro or Bus. Room was spacious with balcony to the inner courtyard (great for breakfast or a wine in the late evening). Nice decorations and modern bath. Everything clean. Free WiFi & fridge in the room. The hotel has a bar and restaurant, but we never made use of it. For breakfast we went to the tabacco shop 50m away where they had fantastic cappucino & espresso plus snacks. In the evening we discovered a local restaurant about 12 min walk past the Metro station. I cannot praise it highly enough: Trattoria Dell'Omo, Viale Guglielmo Marconi, 475. Run by a family, mostly locals eat there, food was FANTASTIC and inexpensive. We went there twice - I wish we had done so more often, but dinner in Trastevere is a MUST as well. This was my fourth visit to Rome: next time I will certainly come back to this place. Apart from the 'usual' sightseeing downtown, I can highly recommend a bicycle ride along Appia Antica (especially when it is hot in the city) and a visit to Ostia.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Prasad N
Reviews.Content: Stayed in pulitzer in september 2011 for 3 nights. Booked few months back and got a good deal without breakfast though for around 120$ per night. Hotel itself is very close to marconi station in Line-B. Facitlies in the hotels are good. Staff was very courteous. Only major thing i noticed in when we were coming back in late night around 11 PM (and another day around 9:30 PM), we were seeing lots of prostitutes standing on the road on the way to the hotel from the metro stop. Not sure it is a regular thing in rome but we were little scared seeing it and wondering whether is it a safe place to walk). But the hotel itself is very nice and beds/rooms are very clean. Tip: there was a fruit shop right opposite to metro. The fruits and water was pretty cheap there and it was open pretty much late in the night. For going to airport, use metro to stop at pramid station (2 stops from marconi) and then use FR1 to travel to fco airport. It was quicker and cheaper this way.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel and city”
Reviews.Author: mharper001
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay at Hotel Pulitzer. Lovely staff and lovely hotel. Very clean, comfortable and modern. Finding the hotel from the airport was an adventure, we took the train from the airport to Tremini, (note when at Tremini station metro tickets are bought in the paper shops) 4euros for a day pass, then head for the B Line and get off at Marconi, turn left and its 2 blocks up on the left. At night there is prostitutes lining the street but they dont bother you. We got around Rome using the metro which was very quick and easy. One day there was a metro and bus strike so we took a taxi to the Vatican which worked out at 18 euros from our hotel, coming back was around 25 euros but we got to see another part of Rome and experiance the crazy driving ha. I would definately reccomend a trip to Piazza Navona day and night, just like Covent Garden, had two lovely meals sat outside which they dont charge extra for either. At the Colosseum we had a lovely snack and drink in a little bar called La Bigga which looked out onto the Colosseum and wasnt expensive. Be warned at the Colosseum there are men dressed as Gladiators getting you to take pics with them, but once you have done this they will ask for money. Vatican was brilliant, the museum and St Peters a definate must see, it was amazing. All in all a fantastic holiday and fantastic city

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but out of centre - not ideal for Rome”
Reviews.Author: MartinV_Zg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Pulitzer Rome for a couple of days in August 2011. For our stay in Rome, we were looking for a small designer hotel with a good value for money, so the Pulitzer was chosen on basis of solid reviews, fair price for superior double room with a breakfast (90 EUR/day) and nice on-line pics. Arrival from Rome rail station Termini to the hotel is easy: only 7 metro stations (1 EUR ticket) and takes about 15 minutes. And here is first "but": metro connection is excellent during the day, but it stops at 23.30 p.m. We thought that will not be a problem for us but beautiful centre of Rome kept us there until late at night - we were always worrying how we will get back to the hotel without relatively expensive taxi (20-25 EUR from the centre to the hotel). Traveler tip: if you are going in Rome as a tourist, pick accommodation in centre - you'll be able to enjoy Rome more. Rome is best explored on foot since the main attractions are on walking distance. Hotel lobby is very nice and stylish. Staff was also polite and they gave us all information we needed - they spoke English well. Room service&cleaning was also on high level. Air-condition was working perfectly so it was really refreshing to enter into the hotel on a hot August days. Our room was spacious but we were a little bit disappointed with it's condition: yes, it is well designed but it is damaged of use and needs renovation ASAP. Some furniture pieces were broken, wooden floor was in a not so nice condition (high-heel trails all over) and curtains could use a better cleaning. Bathroom on the other hand was very clean and modern so that is a big plus! Lot of shampoos and bathroom accessories made it extremely pleasant. Large and comfy bad made us sleep like angels after all day walks in Rome. Air-condition in room was working perfectly. Unfortunately, we did not get a private balcony as we asked during a booking so we had to share a terrace with other guests. Good thing is that other guests in Pulitzer seems to be nice people so that was not a problem. Also, we did not spend much time there because the view is bad - only 15-20 meters from some residential buildings. Better view is on a street side of the hotel - however, there is very busy 6-line road which means noise, smell, dust etc. Free wifi looks good on paper but in reality it did not work on my NOKIA smartphone. Receptionist told me it is due some technical reasons and that it works great with laptops. When I asked to use internet on hotel's laptops in cafeteria, he told me that it costs 6 EUR per hour. Minus! C'mon - in 21st. century they are charging for approach to internet. In my humble opinion it's a robbery because flat rate Internet and PCs are so cheap now-days that there is really no need to charge for that - it's like additional charging for electricity or water used in room. Some nice stuff again: the breakfast was excellent. So many choices including various fresh fruits, beautiful dining room and decorations, free newspapers, real orange juice (not the one mixed with water like in wannabe nice hotels), yummy food... we were really happy going on breakfast. And a couple of words on "red light" neighbourhood: on busy street in front of the hotel is a "pick-up area" for prostitutes, but only in evening. It is not delightful scenery if you are with family so that is a minus. However, hotel facilities are not involved or used for prostitute's activities and their presence did not affect to our stay in the hotel. Finally, I have to say I will not go back to the hotel Pulitzer in Rome: it is not because of hotel itself (hotel is actually really nice, only some improvement are needed) - but it is because it is not in a walking distance from city centre. If that and evening prostitutes are not high in your list of worries - then this hotel might be the just right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: rachius
Reviews.Content: The location is very easily accessible through public transport, the hotel is tastefully decorated with a very inviting bar area near the lobby. The rooms are small but have everything you need, and the front desk staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel and staff, but not location”
Reviews.Author: SkyDallas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful, especially Davide. Our room was spacious in the context of European rooms. We also had a balcony. Breakfast came with the room we purchased, which I would recommend given there are very few restaurants near the hotel. The hotel is located about a block away from the Marconi subway station, so it was fairly easy to get to Rome's center from the hotel. My sole negative (which happens to be a deal breaker) is the prostitution problem. I had read earlier reviews about the prostitutes near the hotel. But the impression that I got was that that the problem was isolated. Its not. Each night, starting around 11:00 pm, the prostitutes were out in numbers and lined the street from the subway station to the hotel. I dont think we were in physical danger, but it was not pleasant to witness women ducking behind buildings with men to perform "transactions."

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Horrible Location”
Reviews.Author: JanaG123
Reviews.Content: The inside of this hotel is very nice. It has a helpful staff, a very nice lounge/bar area, and a lovely breakfast in the mornings in the dining room. Rooms are a good size (for Europe), beds were comfortable, and the bathrooms were clean and spacious. HOWEVER, the location of the hotel is awful. It is truly in the middle of nowhere. It is a hassle to get back at the end of a long touring day to change for dinner and go back to the city center. While it is only about 6 stops on the metro to the Coloseum....you still need to get to where you are going after you arrive there, which will have to be by taxi. The metro in Rome is so crowded and the two lines only run to a certain time. So the only other choice to get to and from Pulitzer is by taxi. So yes, you will be spending the money you saved on the hotel room on taxi fares. Just not worth it. Especially at night when you won't want to be walking to the Metro with all of the hookers lining the street. Wasn't exactly what I needed my son to see on our vacation. The hotel is on its own nestled between apartment buildings. Make sure your room faces the side street or you may hear the local kids running around their complex. If this hotel was in a better neighborhood, it would be an amazing Rome hotel. However, I will definitely be staying in or closer to the City Center on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonclo
Reviews.Content: Very Comfortable, friendly caring staff, clean. Walking distance to subway. Walking distance to good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: chezdaisie
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with a great breakfast and great location. Get off at the Marconi metro stop and walk to the left for about 2 blocks. It's a ways from the 'sites' but it's beautiful. Ask for room 406. You will have your own, private balcony. The street is a little busy so if traffic noise is an annoyance, this would not be a good choice. The room is big, comfortable and very clean. The bathroom is very futuristic. I had a problem with the WiFi but I was able to us their computer in the lounge. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not near the center though”
Reviews.Author: groovyb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the closest subway station. Make sure you turn LEFT and not right to get to the hotel, I didn’t know that. It’s about a 10 minute subway ride to the Coliseum. The hotel is definitely not in the heart of Rome, more in a residential area. The room and bathroom were very clean and there was free Wi-Fi. Overall, a good hotel. Keep in mind that the Metro closes at around 11pm or 12am, so if you don't catch it, you're looking at around a 20 euro cab from the center

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel even though not in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: jhk5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights on my honeymoon & loved the room. I highly recommend the superior room, spacious w/ a great bathroom. Good decor & clean, the staff was also helpful. Breakfast was good, had a little of everything but far from great. Within minutes from the metro. A very good value for the quality of the room but location is not great. If you don't mind a 5-10 minute ride into Rome via metro, I would recommend this hotel. I had a car but it is easier to use the metro or taxi due the parking situation in Rome. You need a parking permit to park in the center of Rome from 6am-6pm. I found out the hard way & got a wheel lock on my car, had to pay 40 euro to take it off & also 39 euro for a ticket. Not fun after great long day of sightseeing. Otherwise was an awesome trip in Rome & can't say enough about the food, it was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great,hotel,yes,but......”
Reviews.Author: bartlett58
Reviews.Content: I must admit.although this is a great hotel,there are a few things ,that as a 4 star hotel,they can do better. If you make a point of advertising "free wi fi", in the rooms, make the financial effort ,to ensure you have decent reception,so guests don't have to go all the way down to the lounge,to get on line. It was also extremely hot and humid,while we were there,and the A/C,in the rooms,turns OFF,when you remove the key card from a slot in the wall,so on return,to room,it is not very,pleasant,to walk into a hot room,too.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, the service was quite bad”
Reviews.Author: DavidPaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for six days during our honeymoon, the place was chosen due to it's distance from the metro and it was indeed very short distance. On the other hand during 5 days we had lots of problems with the air condition (it wasn't cooling only fan) , and during each and every day we informed the reception but they didn't provide any solution. In the end the staff decided to give us one day charge free , and indeed it gave us bit comfort but 5 nights in hot room were bad memorial to our honeymoon

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star hotel by the metro”
Reviews.Author: emileeetravels
Reviews.Content: The price for this hotel in June was very fair considering the quality of the hotel. The hotel is very clean, modern, and is a true 4* - not like those old dingy hotels that are really more like 3.5* or even lower. There is nothing much around the hotel but it is only a few minutes from the metro stop, where you can access the rest of Rome easily.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Experience”
Reviews.Author: lvco724
Reviews.Content: First night was ok, second night the key would not work to our room and the rooms electrical system went out. They moved us to a nicer room, only problem is the new rooms air conditioner was broken, finally at 1130 at night they got us into another room after much complaining that I was not staying in the hot room nicer or not. Finally today we go down for breakfast, I come back up to the room and a cleaning lady is in my room and my key will not work to get in the room. The lady comes out and looks surprised and tells me she has left us robes. 9 in the morning, robes, really? No cleaning just robes! I go to the desk, get my key reactivated and when my wife and I get to the room, $10 in change is gone, no kidding, it was right on the desk in plain sight. As an officer in the states I am not an idiot! I have two more nights at this place and am trying to rebook our flights to get back to the states as we speak. The hotel is nice, but nothing has gone right for us, and the theft tops it off. I never write reviews so take it to heart! But internet was good!

Reviews.Title: “Modern friendly hotel close to Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: KDWNorfolk
Reviews.Content: Modern Hotel with friendly staff, located central to most of the main attractions only a few stops away on the Metro line. We were bed and breakfast only, the breakfast was buffet style, with a good variety of foods After a day of sightseeing and walking, we used to relax and soak up the sun on the comfy sofa of the hotel garden with a glass of refreshing cold beer from the bar The room was well appointed with minibar, flatscreen tv, safe and tea & coffee making facilities

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry, but the Pulitzer is satisfactory to good, not more”
Reviews.Author: Aethelred
Reviews.Content: I am a bit surprised at the high level of good grades this hotel gets. I was there with many fellow conference attendees for a week, and nobody liked it that much. Sure, there are good aspects, but the hotel is quite run down, all rooms are extremely noisy, the maid service is not thorough, hooks and switches etc. are often loose, the weekend reception staff cannot cope really well, even doubles are quite restricted in space, the breakfast is just okay, and of course, the hotel is far away from anything in Rome except Roma Tre and St. Paul. But the Metro is close by and some good buses stop literally in front. Some of the criticism voiced here I can not follow: There are restaurants and shops etc. less than 10 minutes away by foor (behind the hotel) and less than 5 by bus (metro passes, and one should get a weekly one, work on buses as well). If one turns left from the hotel and follows the road, in 5-10 minutes one hits upon a large Carrefour supermarket with extended opening times (for Italy that is). And I have to say I did not notice any working girls on the street. But still, it's an expensive *** hotel off the center, modernism always looks bad if faded (rather than XIXth C. style, which may look elegantly threadbare), and I would not stay there again. One additional points: Singles are tiny and quite dysfunctional; I stayed in one for one night and then could upgrade myself (for just € 10 a night!) to a double-for-single which, while not exactly spacious, was functional.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: bettsyHarrow
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with friends at the Pulitzer.We found the location fantastic. The Marconi metro was only about 50 metre's away and the bus stop right outside. This made getting around Rome really easy. The room's were really clean.Small but tastefully decorated. The breakfast had plenty of choice allthough the hot breakfast was really cold. I realise that Italians serve their food cooler than we Brits would eat it but this was silly. Apart from the cold egg and bacon,our stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location for getting on the Metro.”
Reviews.Author: bluwaterz
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms and short walk to Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: PHFerreira78
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Hotel Pulitzer Roma. The hotel is really good. Nice staff, good restaurant, excellent breakfast (really good!). The room is silent, confort, with a nice balcony and good landscape. The bathroom is clean and modern. Only one point that we must highlight: despite of the near tube (Marconi station, really near), the hotel is far from downtown, in a isolated area. In other words, there is nothing to do in the neighborhood at night (its a residential area, with no restaurants or stores around). So, once you go back to the hotel, there is no way to get out again. But the hotel has a good restaurant for dinner and, after a intense tourist day in Rome, its a great place to relax. We will recommend this hotel to friends and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for Metro but nightmare with Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: MEP-UK
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a lot for business so I know that a clean, quiet room is a genuine luxury - and that is what I got here; with air conditioning that worked! Plug sockets were a bit flakey - some worked and some didn't - but on the whole the room was lovely and the staff were polite and helpful. When I booked I said that I was working whilst in Rome so needed a quiet room which I got - brilliant! However it is pretty near impossible to work these days if the Wi-Fi doesn't!! The signal was poor in my room anyway and then the whole system just died - just as I needed to do some late night emails - grrrrrrr! And using a cable didn't help because the connector in the room didn't work. I couldn't get any help from reception other than suggesting that I move to the busy bar to work - which wasn't an option (confidentality!). I'm back in Rome for work again and I will probably try my luck somewhere else. Looks like a great holiday hotel though...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellabe
Reviews.Content: If you like a bit of luxury but can't afford to pay a too high price go for this hotel. Is not too far from the city with a couple of metro stops to majour attractions. It very convenient placed 5 min walk to Marconi train station . this station will llink you to all major attractions. There is a bus in front of the hotel that takes you down Trastevere where from you can walk to Campo di fiori area. We had the superior room 603 for four nites. I think all the superior rooms are on this floor and they all exit a private terrace with chairs and tables excellent for having a cigarette and a glas of wine. The room has nice amenities and bath tab.I'd like to thank the stuff for being very helpful trying to make us enjoy our stay. I appreciate the extra pillows and the hot milk request when the restaurant was closed. thank you will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lakshi79
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel.bit overpriced paid about 165 euros per night though it was in a suburb.It was 3 stations away from colosseum and the marconi station is only 5 mins away from the hotel.Staff were helpful and friendly.Clean rooms very trendy. Quiet,Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: grig05
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to city centre and metro station is only 2 min. away. The stuff of the hotell is perfect. Polite and ready to give kindly any information needed. The room was clean and comfortable with all the necessities. Breakfast had everything you can possible imagine!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services, helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: fotini_gr_piraeus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days. The staff in the reception and in the lobby were very kind and helpfull. The room was small but sufficient, equipped with a desk and a plasma tv and the bathroom was perfect. Both of them were full of cleanliness. The staff cleaned the room every day. In addition there was room service and laundry/ironing service but we didn't use them. The only "bad thing" is that in the room there was more heat than should have but you still could open the a/c.The hotel provided furthermore a typical american breakfast. It was good enough and I have to admit that everything was warm and tasty. The hotel is fairly near to metro station (about 200m)and has bus stop just outside that transfer you to piazza Venezia which is near to all sights. The night we preffered the bus as the connections of metro system in Rome are awful. The area is safe with many people moving around but the night there are prostitudes across the road, but they will not bother you anyway. I would certainly reccomended it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, nice staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: asrs
Reviews.Content: The staff is very nice and efficient; the rooms are very comfortable and roomy, with well equiped bathrooms; good location (near from subway station and bus stop with direct connection to the city centre); excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: eazyeh
Reviews.Content: I spent nine nights here and found it to be a great place to stay. It was very close to the metro station and the room was beautiful with very comfortable bedding. I would gladly stay here again should I return to Rome. I hope I can book this hotel on my trip to Barcelona next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler55
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not what I expected based on it's 4 star rating, the pictures on their website and the cost (yes, I know Rome is expensive). First, our room smelled like sewage everytime we walked into the room. Second, the bathroom is smaller than a closet (but it looks much bigger in the pictures I saw on the website). The rooms were in need of painting. All the staff were very friendly except for the guy that checked us in (he was rude). He was there in the mornings so we made sure we asked the friendly staff at night for directions and any other info. we needed for the next day. The breakfast was standard, but good. There was a "grocery store" (a very small store) two doors down from the hotel that sells cheap bottled water. The hotel is only 2 blocks from a metro stop and there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel. One thing to note is that if you stay here, make sure you know how to get back to the hotel after dinner. Metro A stops at 9pm (this is near the city center). So you need to take a bus from the city center to Metro B which gets you to the hotel. It's not hard, but you just need to make sure you know where you can get the bus. Even though I was dissappointed at how incredibly small the bathroom was, I still would recommend the hotel. It's convinent because of it's location near the metro and the rooms are actually not as small as most hotel rooms in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Infecteddice
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived we were given a warm welcome, and made sure that our room was ready. Our room was GORGEOUS! Well decorated, cute little bathroom and a very comfortable bed. The view from the windows aren't amazing, but that didn't bother us. Infact we quite liked watching the locals passing! and despite traffic going past the hotel it never bothered us. The local area is basic, just a nice little local area which has supermarkets heading further down to your left as well as some restaurants (and if you continue you can venture into the EUR district, although this is a bit of a walk), but if you head to your right from the hotel, you will come to the nearest metro station Marconi, about 5 mins or even less away. The metro only takes 10 mins to get into central and is very cheap! The Staff were helpful, spoke good English and took very good care of us. Breakfast is a little expensive but worth the value. The little bar is also nice with a pretty veranda on the outside. I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone! Worth the money. Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: randomgirl41
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. Staff are awkward and unwelcoming. The room was ok. Not especially clean but was not terrible. I would not stay there again due to the staff. The location is quite good as its right next to the station, however the hotel is situated on the main road so the view isn't much. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that we were too early to check in even though they hadn't bothered to send us details of when check in was. We asked if we could leave our bags there in which none of the staff said anything and started typing on the computer. They did book us in early and gave us the room key. It was very confusing as obviously the room was ready so we could go up but they didn't bother to say anything else to us. We had to find our own way to our room and no one helped with our bags. I felt extremely uncomfortable whenever I was in reception. Overall awkward stay.

Reviews.Title: “modern, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: stemege
Reviews.Content: When driving last spring from the airport to town I had to stop at a traffic light on via Marconi and saw:Hotel Pulitzer.It looked nice and modern and I stopped to have a closer look.The receptionist and Manager was so kind to show me different rooms from diff.categories,gave me the customercode to get special discount thru Internet and since then I always stay there,alone or w/friends.The rooms are all different,well furnished,safe deposit,flatscreen nd free internet(if u bring ur own laptop).Otherwise in the lounge Internet against charge.A nice breakfast buffet&even lunch or dinner.Next door is a bar for coffee&sandwhich starting at 7am.Metro 200m,bus-stop in front.Parking on the street(foc!).Rooms to the court are quiet,towards mainroad noisy.Great fitnessroom!in summer open court for breakfast etc.At Apérétif-time drinks w/snack-buffet.From Stazione Ostiense (which is 3Metro-Stops,get off at "Piramide")the train to Fiumicino-airport.A restaurant for fish and pizza(Vecchia Posta) which is nearby but not reachable by foot,has an arrangement w/Pulitzer to pick-up the guests,which I found exceptionally kind:-) At Piramide is an excellent Roman Restaurant:la Valetta.Reservation necessary,has small terrace in summer - very good roman dishes,not expensive

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing hotel, the staff could not have been more helpful.”
Reviews.Author: ToniAB
Reviews.Content: The hotel - very much like Barcelona in style, but best of all they captured the same relaxed feeling in the lounge bar. Everything was very clean and generous. Breakfast was very good. Our rooms on both occasions were very comfortable. The staff - as I said, they were very helpful with all our needs and questions. The area - though it is in the newer part of the city, an area we hadn't stayed before, it was very convenient to get there on the tube (we had never used the tube in Rome before but it was great). The short walk from the tube to the hotel isn't wonderful but being there fully compensated for that. I think when Rome is hot it might be nice to get out of the city and not be taking buses etc. We would go back in the future if we are lucky enough to visit Rome. p.s. The business center is just a computer and printer in the corner of the lounge, not a separate room, which we thought was good as you weren't cut of from the ambiance of the environment. Also there was free wi-fi when using your own laptop/notebook.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: MarkWagner
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Pulitzer Hotel for 5 Nights during December 2010. An easy 15-20 minute ride with the Metro from the Termini station gets you to the Marconi station nearby the Hotel and its 2minute walk from the station to the Hotel. It may not be in the city centre but the location is not a hassle when exploring. Most of the tours companies pick you up from your hotel. The Colosseo station is 5-10 minutes with metro and it is centrally located to most of the sites when you don’t mind walking to get to all the sites. I don’t know if it is standard practice now a days but police officers patrolled the stations and sites and after reading some shacky reports of Rome it was an extremely relaxing experience for us. The Hotel was decorated smartly/modern. The staff was friendly and helpful and the food was excellent. Our room was clean and cleaned daily. A safe and bar fridge in the room was a great bonus. The room had a big comfortable bed. We read in previous posts that it is scary to walk from the station to the Hotel at night and that there is prostitutes standing across the Hotel. In our five nights we never felt that it is unsafe to walk from the station to the Hotel (the street is light up with street lights) and we never saw any strange figures lurking the streets. We will recommend this Hotel to any one visiting Rome. The location is not bad, the price for our stay was great and the service and overall experience was super. If only all Italians were set on service and friendliness as the Pulitzer Hotel, Rome could easily be one of the best places in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boekstar
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time there. The hotel is not in the very center located, but it doesn't matter because it's almost right next to the subway station Marcone which is just 4 stations away from Collosseum. The hotel has very nice interieur, nice English speaking staff, bathroom is nice and it's clean in general. I would like to point out the good breakfast buffet as well. The rooms are a bit small, but still alright. At night it was a bit warm, but apart from this it was great. We warmly recommend it and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and clean hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AntonisMarg
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel with very good price next at the metro station!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again and reccomend it to others”
Reviews.Author: benjyboo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights/6 days and it didn't dissapoint in the least. I would stay here again when visiting Rome and have recommended the place to my friends and family. We stayed in a Deluxe room, which was on the top floor of the building (6th floor). When placing my reservation, I had requested for a quieter room and was given a room not facing the main road (looking onto a small field and residential area). The room came with a huge shared balcony area, dotted with olive trees. Plus points: -Room was large, very comfortable and well decorated. Room was cleaned daily and was spotless. -Bathroom, though a little small was always kept clean and well stocked. -Large bed with comfortable, firm mattress (very handy after a long day of sight-seeing). We were well rested after each nights sleep. -Lovely restaurant downstairs serving up a good continental breakfast spread. -Trendy bar area, cosy too. We were invitied to a reception at the bar the first night we arrived. -Free WiFi. -5-8mins walk to the Marconi Metro (underground/tube) stationed, which is well linked to Termini and other popular tourist destinations (Vatican etc.) -Direct bus service into town - bus stop right in front of hotel. -Helpful front desk service and responsive room service. -15 paces from the hotel is a cafe serving up small eats and good coffee. -10-15 mins walk is a large grocery store (Carfour) and a neighbourhood eatery. -Not located in the mad tourist trap area - we chose this place specifically because of this - being walking distance to a Metro station meant we could get everywhere really quickly. -There are a lot of good neighbourhood eateries around the other Metro stations (before Marconi station stop), that serve up better food than the ones near the tourist draws, and way more affordable. -Though we checked out at 12pm, our flight was later in the day. We were able to leave our luggage in the reception office and do our last bit of sight seeing. Cons - It was November and about 22 deg celcius. We found it a little warm but was unable to use the air-conditioning. For some reason it had been turned off or not working. This was a minor inconvenience - we were able to open the windows and balcony doors to ventilate the room. I was a little apprehensive at first, when I read about street walkers turning up at the enterance of the hotel. We never saw any hovering around the hotel enterance, but we saw 2 or 3 standing by the road side - they weren't even on the kerb. Also the walkway between the tube station and hotel is fairly well lit. We didn't feel fearful walking back to the hotel in the evenings. Overall a good hotel and a great place to stay when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: papdan
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean hotel that was handy to public transportation. Rooms were nicely decorated and well maintained. Breakfast buffett was good but didn't change. Beds were the most comfortable we have ever experienced at a hotel. Walking the two blocks from the Metro in the dark at night could be an issue. We never had any problems. There were prostitutes almost every night on the street but most of the time they were across the four lane street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, definitely recommend for tourists!”
Reviews.Author: milica0207
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer for 3 nights in October and loved it. There were no prostitutes in sight. Breakfast was amazing. Room was very modern, particularly liked the modern bathroom. 1 mistake I made was I didn't take my usual 5kg of toiletries thinking that they'd provide plenty of shampoo/conditioner/shower gel. They do provide it but in very small bottles. No conditioner though girls! I also couldn't find a shop to buy any in the centre. The metro is about 2 mins walk away and tickets only cost 1euro per trip. Takes about 10mins to Colosseo which was no problem. The metro stops running at 11.30 during the week so make sure you don't miss the last train back!! Watch out for gypsies at the ticket machines in Termini station. They put cardboard or something inside to catch the change coming out to steal it from you so just move to a machine that doesn't have swarms of gypsies around it!! Being slightly out of the centre was no problem at all for us. It was worth it to get this nice modern hotel. If you're visiting the Colosseum buy your tickets down the road at the Palatino because there won't be a queue. Queues at Colosseum are huge as are the queues at the Vatican. If you don't make it into the Vatican go up to the coppola of St Peter's Basilica, it's a good view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Poor Location for Tourist, but fine for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: PurdueGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early October and overall had a good experience. I was there for a total of 4 nights. The staff is helpful, but does not go out of its way to be friendly. That goes for the front desk clerk and those who server the breakfast. The breakfast is quite good, and the choices plentiful. The fruit was terrific and so were the baked goods. The only downside of this hotel is the location. It is on the subway line, but you need to take a 15 to 20 subway ride to get to most historic sights. If you are only in Rome for business and your office is near this hotel, then it is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Interest stay- free show to peek everynight!”
Reviews.Author: jwylam
Reviews.Content: IT IS TRUE that there are 1-2 prostitutes standing around the entrance of the hotel everynight waiting for a pick up. Our room was right on top of the entrance facing the street, and every night every now and then i get curious and would start peeking out the window to see whether the girls are still there or not. Hotel is very modern looking, Id say the website looks a lot nicer than its property itself. The hotel is well decorated, and it is around 1 min walk to the metro station. ( like 3 stations away from Pyramid station, where you can change there to take the train to the Fiumicino Airport). It is pretty close to the Colloseo as well. The hotel is a little bit out of the CENTER of the city. but its not far and its pretty convenient. Room size is good, but toilet is a bit small. We stayed there for 3 nights. The first night we arrived at 9 pm and there were no restaurants near by so we had to eat at the bar. Don't know whether it was late or the staff just had pure bad attitude. The service wasn't that friendly and the barman just gave me a ' oh look at me, im so tired after a long day of work just order!!!" face. 2nd day: I put the "please clean my room" sign on my door, and when i came back to the hotel, it was turned the other way saying" please do not disturb". Housekeeping didn't clean my room and turned out we had no clean towels. Receptionists went to back office and found NO towels and had no keys to access the storage. At the end we had to go to the guest toilet and took all the 'hand towels' ( like 10 mini towels the size of an A4 paper) and used that to dry us up after shower. There were two receptionists, one was really helpful, trying to look and see how to help us, but the other one just told me' you shouldn't have put the sign on , they'll clean the room" .Felt like i was the one to blame that housekeeping didnt' clean my room and the hotel does not have back up towels... Besides the towel and barman problem, everything was good. I reflected my towel problem with another receptionist when i checked out and he waived my spendings at the bar which was very nice of him. Afterall its not the hotels fault, i guess the housekeeping is hired from another company to do the cleaning and leaves in the afternoon. I suggest the hotel to have a key to the storage for housekeeping incase future guests would like extra towels or shampoo etc. Check out receptionist handled the case well and I'd consider to return next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, awful internet”
Reviews.Author: oink2u
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well decorated, clean, and helpful staff. There is a minibar fridge (to stash your perishables) and a small safe to lock your stuff during the day. Each room had a balcony (although there wasn't much to see - just an empty field and the major road with lots of traffic.) The location was a quick 5min walk from the Marconi Metro station and the area is very safe during the day as well as at night. (However, there was more than a few prostitutes walking the streets in front of the hotel at night...) The one thing that drove me crazy: free internet that was slower than dial-up! omg, not only was the connection spotty (we were on the far end of the hotel, so that might have played a part in the limited connectivity), but it moved SO SLOW, I was about to pull my hair out. just checking email each night was a task. They definitely need to do something about the wireless. Otherwise, all other parts of the hotel were great. No breakfast included. We had a great time in Rome. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE FOR LEISURE AND WORK”
Reviews.Author: Lal077
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights working on a report and taking in the sights and cuisine of Rome by night. Wonderful facilities, very modern, extremely quiet surroundings and 100 meters to the Metro and a very reasonable price. Lal Kuru

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for visiting Rome - Book Now!”
Reviews.Author: scottycardiff
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 6 night stay in Rome based on the good reviews and the good price and were not disappointed. The Hotel is modern, stylish and very clean. The staff were courteous, helpful and friendly despite our poor Italian! I would definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone visiting Rome and would stay here again if returning to Rome. The room was a decent size for a Rome Hotel with a very large very comfortable bed, LCD TV with sky, fridge, air-con, lots of closet space, a stylish bathroom with bath and shower and a balcony. The Hotel also offers free wi-fi access which was very useful for planning our time there and looking up restaurant reviews on trip advisor! The room was cleaned everyday. This Hotel isn't located right in the historic centre of Rome (if it was then the rate would be at least double and probably not as nice), however it's located just a 3 minute walk from the 'Marconi' Metro station. We bought a €4 metro pass each day which gets you everywhere in the city and lets you use the bus and tram system as well. It was about a 10-15 min journey by metro to the Colosseum. When the metro stops we used the night bus (n3) which stops right outside the hotel so we never had any problems getting around. The breakfast Buffet was probably the best one i've had in Italy with a very wide selection enough to keep anyone happy (cereals, breads, pastries, meats, cheeses, yoghurts, fresh fruits, egg, bacon etc) along with fresh coffees and teas. The Hotel also has a nice lounge area and outside seating area to the rear which served a selection of cocktails, snacks and meals.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: ExprncdTrvler3333
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights here and had a really great stay. I booked it because it was less than 99Euros per night but would have paid more for this place. This hotel is away from the city center but there is a Metro station one block away that is only 10 minute / 3-4 stops into Rome. The area seemed pretty quiet and unfortunately there are NO places to eat at all around the hotel. We had heard that it was kinda a sketchy area but we did not notice any problems during the day but we were not out there in the middle of the night either. The hotel is VERY nice and VERY clean. It has a really neat design in the Lobby and it was carried throughout the rooms. We had a very spacious and comfortable standard room. Nice bed and bathroom/shower. We had a balcony with a view of nothing special but was nice to have anyways. There is free internet (which was kinda slow) but worked! There was also a free breakfast included which was actually REALLY good (muffins, pastries, eggs, juices, teas, coffees, fruit, toast, cereal, etc.) The staff spoke english and were very accommodating. The hotel also had a bar and restaurant that we didnt try out but it was nice to have it there none-the-less. Overall we had a great stay and I would definitely stay here again for this price. It is a hidden gem and was a great value. It is a downside being out of Rome a little bit but being how easy it is to get into the city it was worth saving on a dump in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: bernadettj
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel and had a wonderful time there. The service was excellent, the staff was very friendly and helpful.The location is good, the metro is just a few steps away. The breakfast was great and offers a wide selection. We can only recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “my new home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PH_KP
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with lovely rooms (with a very nice interior). Very friendly (english speaking) staff. Great breakfast. Located 500 m from the subwaystation. This hotel is not in the old citycenter. You need to take the subway everytime you leave the hotel. In the neighbourhood of the hotel there is absolutely nothing to see or to do. But the hotel itself is a hidden gem. Personally i prefer this kind of hotel, rather than staying in an overcrowded tourist trap with a view to eg piazza del popolo .

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it for families”
Reviews.Author: Daisy7425
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about 7 nights and though the rooms were lovely, we were disappointed with the level of service. As we were staying for leisure and a conference, we had to check in 3 times, they'd managed to lose the copies of our passports. There were no ironing facilities in the room, or tea & coffee. There were prostitutes hanging out on the street every night we were there (though that did make for some entertaining evenings watching them hide from the police). When we asked about directions on walking into town (fully aware that its about 7kms out of Rome) they told us it was far, and then told us to just head down the street and ask people for directions. There were a few other things that just made it frustrating. I suppose if you're there as a couple it would be OK - the metro is only a few minutes down the street - but for a young family struggling with a pram it was inconvenient. If they improved their level of service it would be a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of nicest rooms I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: beninsea
Reviews.Content: This hotel had one of the nicest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in - much nicer than hotels that are much more expensive. The design of the rooms and also the lobby and bar/reading room are exceptional. The lighting system in the rooms is so complicated it took a bit for me to figure out (you have to leave your key card in a slot - or it thinks no one is in the room). The big disadvantage of the hotel is its location - It's on a busy street in what seems like the middle of nowhere. There are no restaurants we were able to find in walking distance. BUT, the subway station is a mere 2 blocks away, which will whisk you to the Colisseum in 20 minutes. This is not quite as good as it seems because the Rome metro doesn't cover much of the city - but still we very much looked forward to returning to the hotel each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews - Service terrible when I arrived but day staff is nice”
Reviews.Author: mbanderson
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very kool, but is far away from the centre. It is located on a very busy suburb street, where sex workers hang out in the evenings. Not great for family's to see. The area is not the best and if you plan on going out late the gate is locked and there is no security to let you in. For Rome standards the hotel inside is nice. The service from the front desk depending on who checks you in, you will find some of them rude. Some of the rooms are very small, so if you are staying here pay for the upgrade. It is close to the the subway but again not close to the centre. You are better off paying a little more money and staying near the centre. Like in Capo d'africa hotel etc. Overall the hotel was okay but because I am oftern in Rome I will pay the extra money to stay at Capo D'africa or Radisson Blu near Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory second stay”
Reviews.Author: PearlyPotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer from 4th to 11th May having stayed there previously 18 months ago. We booked through lastminute.com and this time we were allocated a standard rather than a superior room. The room was on the ground floor (number 105) and it faced a side street next to the hotel but it was below street level. This meant that we had to have the semi sheer curtains closed all of the time otherwise anyone passing by could have looked down into our room. Apart from this the room was adequate for our needs so we did not complain and try to change to another room. The booking did not include breakfast but we paid 50% more last time so we did not mind foregoing the breakfast, or the larger room. The bed was huge and whilst it was a little firm for me, a quick discussion with the member of staff on Reception resulted in an additional duvet being provided which I used as a mattress topper - perfect. We slept really well. The location of the hotel away from the city centre means that it was quiet with very little traffic noise during the night (but only 7 metro stops from Termini). The bathroom had a shower over the bath which had a shower head which could also be hand held; I dislike fixed shower heads. There is room in the minibar to chill a bottle of wine should you bring one back to the room but no tea and coffee making factilities unless you take your own kettle like we did. There was free wi-fi in the hotel but when we returned to the hotel to collect our luggage on the final day and wanted to check if our flight was going to be on time the hotel wanted to charge us 3 euros to use one of their PC's for 15 minutes. We got our own notebook out and logged on using the code previoulsy given to us. In summary - we like the location of the hotel and if we had not had a larger room on a higher floor previously we would have been happier with the room we were allocated this time. Breakfast would have been a bonus but it was not even offered to us at an extra charge. We would however return to this hotel on a future trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: algarveholiday
Reviews.Content: Very pleasent and helpful staff. The rooms were nice and clean although not alot of wardrobe space for a long stay. While the hotel was outside of the city centre it actually didn't matter as there is a meto station only a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. This made access to the centre very easy and was only seven stops (10-15 minutes) from Termini. Would definately return to this hotel and found it to be good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel, worth its money”
Reviews.Author: spyr0s
Reviews.Content: We liked the Pulitzer hotel, because it was very clean and well decorated. The staff was very helpful. Additionally the metro station was only 150m from the hotel and there was a bus station right outside of it, so the transportation to the historic center was very easy. The breakfast was quite good. Also the price was good enough(compared to the prices you will find in the historic center).

Reviews.Title: “stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom088
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the pulitzer with our teenage daughter and booked a double and a single. Both rooms were very elegant with nice size bathrooms and really clean. Breakfast consisted of various pastries, fresh fruit and eggs, a choice of coffees all served with a smile. The hotel is about 10 minutes from the underground station which gets you to the city in roughly 15 minutes. There is also a bus stop right in front of the hotel. All three of us had a very pleasant time and would certainly come again.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AgarwalTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Feb2010 and had absolutely no problem of any type. The staff is courteous and very helpful. It is a sparkling clean hotel with great rooms. The location is excellent with bus stand in front of hotel itself and metro station at walking distance. Hotel staff arranges Taxi and other services in no time. The breakfast was decent and well taken care off. I totally enjoyed my stay here. Also, they have free wi-fi internet which is absolutely must in todays time. I was impressed by the speed of wi-fi. Highly recommened

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: richsedgewick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit out of the way, but convenient for meetings at the University of Roma Tre. It is on a subway line, but probably still a bit out of the way for a tourist visit to the pretier parts of Rome. I was pleasantly surprised by the room, with balcony (though no view), and relatively spacious (for Rome) bathroom. The staff was ok, though a bit unattentive.

Reviews.Title: “Very design and clean, great value for money. 5 min from metro station”
Reviews.Author: ClementfromParis
Reviews.Content: Very design and clean hotel, great value for money even if you take a superior room. 5 min from metro station (5 stops from the Colloseum).

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is really wonderful, and represents exceptional value in Rome. It is clean, modern, comfortable, and upbeat. The staff couldn't be more attentive or helpful. Rooms are good size, bed comfortable, bathroom has all of the amenities necessary. Any concerns represented about the location are overblown. While not in the center of Rome, the neighborhood is residential, and the hotel is a very short walk to the Marconi metro station (B line), which gets you to the center of Rome fairly quickly. I will absolutely stay there again on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a business trip but wrong location for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: Ox0nian
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is a modern, minimalist hotel on a main road in one of the southern suburbs of Rome near the Marconi metro station. I was accompanying my husband who was attending a conference, so our stay was a combination of business and leisure. The hotel was clean and well-equipped (air conditioning, wi-fi etc), but the room was small - just enough space to walk around the bed. The main disadvantage was the location, as the hotel has no restaurant, just a breakfast room and a bar, and it was very difficult to find anywhere in the area to eat in the evenings. If you are planning a sightseeing holiday you would probably be better off booking a hotel closer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “What a tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: FranBoyle
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has some plusses. The front desk personnel are efficient, and the hotel is pretty good. We were given a VERY large room, but due to a fault we were quickly relocated to a room nearby. It was tiny, and I mean TINY! The cupboard hardly fitted our things for just two overnight stays. No room at all for moving about: Every time I went to bed/the toilet I banged my right thigh against the very sharp corner of the desk, with the result of coming away with a big nasty-looking bruise. The bathroom was similarly small, with a silly sink. We asked for a top up of toiletries (the supply amounted to one hotel-size cake of soap, meant to do the two of us for two overnight stays), and the smiling staff kindly ignored us. The mosquito we killed in the sink kept us company for a day and a half. The hotel is located very handily near the Marconi underground stop. It overlooks a busy road, and you can tell it is getting wake-up time by the noise of the cars, despite the thick windows. The road is dark at night, and as we were walking back to the hotel at 10 p.m after we had had our dinner nearby we spotted two prostitutes changing into their working clothes just behind a wheelie bin on the main road, a mere 50 mt. away from the hotel entrance. Breakfast was ok, but prefab. The breakfast staff were efficient and helpful. I had two lovely lattes. I believe that the original room we were given would have turned out into a better review. As it stands, a medicre choice (despite the plasma screen and fancy design furniture - I kept banging against...) in a mediocre location in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: husocan
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. With its newly and modernly decorated rooms and its close location to metro line b (marconi station is 3-4 minutes walk on the same main street), this is a great place to stay. Very clean and even full of luxury that you will love. I want to go to Rome again, only to stay there. Do not miss it, if you have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: australianidol
Reviews.Content: Pulitzer was the best hotel in out 20 days journey around Italy and France. We were very impressed by the rooms (good size comparing to hotels in other cities and modern decor) and the quality of service. Gym was a good amendment too. It was of a reasonable size with all necessary equipment. We arrived early, 5-6 hours before check-in time. However, we were given the room without any delay and extra charge. Staff was very helpful. A bit far from the centre but it feels like it is more cool and quite comparing to noisy and hot city. Once you figure out how to use metro - it is quite easy and fast to travel to main attractions. Breakfast is good and has variety of food. However, the choice did not change a tiny bit for all 5 nights we stayed there. Would recommend to make some changes in the menu from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “If you're traveling on business I could understand staying here”
Reviews.Author: ArtieBklyn
Reviews.Content: it's across the street from one of the primary train station "hubs" and is located on a busy roundabout that rivals Rome in its trepidation to cross....so the location is just not the greatest. Its a decent hike to most everywhere you'll probably be touring. As for the hotel itself, despite the friendly staff, its as soulless a corporate hotel as ever there was. The hotel rooms have cold marble floor with no rugs and the furnishings feel like they were just moved out of a conference center. We chose this place for budget reasons solely and in that regard it did not disappoint but after our stay (and traveling throughout the country) we would certainly buck up a little extra and go another route next time.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: SamMaes
Reviews.Content: If you ever visited the Pulitzer in Barcelona, this Pulitzer is a real joke. The staff isn't friendly neither helpful. The reception staff isn't helping. When checking out they started talking to each other in stead of helping me. No thank you, no goodbye. I still had some questions, but they didn't have any interest. In the breakfast area you need to ask for everything. The staff doesn't add anything to the buffet. The location is far from the city center. The metro doesn't run late, so you need to take a taxi (appr. € 15,00). The rooms aren't as pretty as on the website, neither as the ones from the Pulitzer in Barcelona. They aren't cleaned well either. I certainly won't stay again there next time. And no wonder GR group is selling this hotel, it doesn't do any good to the Pulitzer name.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly poor”
Reviews.Author: dorisltw
Reviews.Content: With all the good reviews, we decided to end our european trip at Roma by staying in this hotel. Having looked at the photos & the website, we thought it was a new & stylish hotel, however, we stayed in on last sat for just one night and the experience was TERRIBLE. First of all, the room isn't new as it seemed on web, the wooden floor is old and cracked everywhere in the room, and it was dusty, which gave me a very poor first impression while entering the room. Then it was about the lack of air-conditioning!! OMG, can you imagine paying over 120 Euro to stay in a hotel without air-con?? Luckily the weather is not burning right now, but to avoid the flies, we can't open windows/door of the terrace, which essentially means we are being forced to suffocate. Nonetheless the TV reception was so poor and the speed of internet was so slow too. When we called at reception to complain about the air-con, the gal said it has been broken down for the ENTIRE WEEK, and they can do nothing about that (not even to provide some free drinks at mini-bar to cool us down!), and they sounded that they are NOT going to do anyth to ease the situation or to at least pacify the guests. Worst enough, we have to turn the lights off inside our room to avoid being over-heated. Come on, such condition can be worst enough to compare with sleeping at hostels and those hotel paying much less. We would feel a lot better if we were being notified before we arrive or during our check-in, but NO, sounded like they try to cover this up not until the guests discover it themselves and then you are left with no choice but to tolerate such situation. Strongly NOT recommend to anyone, unless u want to waste your money on a place to ruin your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shakalake
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best in Rome! The Staff is friendly and the rooms is very cool. By metro the centre just 10 minute!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Modern, Clean and ...”
Reviews.Author: pfitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: Very nice and attentive staff, but they never got our room-service orders correct. Lack of Italian on my part, English on theirs. Clean and modern, cool bathrooms. Seemed most of the guests were there for business purposes. For sight-seeing in Rome, its location was a little far away unless you wanted to take a taxi or the Metro (only one block away, so that was easy). The price was right, the breakfast was good but a little pricey. I wouldn't recommend it only because of it's location relative to the sights in Rome. Otherwise, though, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for an amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: cstcyr77
Reviews.Content: I run a large Mercedes Benz dealership and practice excellent customer service every day. So~ when I am provided with that same excellent experience I am certain to give credit where it is due! This was my 2nd trip to Rome, this time traveling with a girlfriend. This hotel is not only beautiful & comfortable but also convenient. The metro stop is literally 2 blocks away. It took us 7 stops (10 min) to get to termini, 20 min to get to the Vatican. If coming from the airport, take a train to Pirimide and then hop on the metro from there. It is 5 Euros vs. 11 Euros for the Leonardo express and you will save yourself a lot of time and effort. I should also mention you are a 23 minutes (40 Euro) cab ride to Fuicimico. We arrived and were quickly checked in. A chilled bottle of procceso was awaiting us. We called down and asked for 2 more pillows and Wi-Fi access, no problem & Wi-Fi was free. Our room was plenty big for 2 gals with 2 LG suitcases and they even had 2 suitcase racks in the room. Bed was SUPER comfy, as were the sheets. The bath was modern and even had a REAL hairdryer for us gals to use. The concierge made all our dinner reservations for us ahead of time via email, helped with public transport, and never made us feel any less then truly welcome. After 4 nights we left for Turkey, but were returning before departing for home. We loved this hotel and its staff so much; we booked our last night here as well. The hotel gladly honored the SAME rate! If I HAD to point out something less than perfect. (I am stressing HAD) The breakfast was only ok. But I am nit picking here. I JUST paid FAR more at a 5 start hotel and got WAY less than my stay at the Hotel Pulitzer. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates comfort and excellent service. ]

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Killer Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: BananasFromLG
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer's proximity to the Rome metro system is excellent! It's about a 3 minute walk through a perfectly safe part of town. You walk by a few shops including a scooter store, small grocery store, and a film place I think. There's also a post box right on the way to the metro for all those Colliseum postcards! I never felt unsafe whatsoever during the three minute walk. The hotel is located at the Marconi stop of the B (blue) line. It's about 8 or so stops to Rome Termini and takes maybe 15 minutes or so. When exiting the metro station, turn left and walk about 800 feet. The hotel is on a corner on the left side of the street. Served from 7:30 until 10, the breakfast was the best we had out of all the hotels we stayed in. There were fresh orange, honeydew, orange, pineapple, and kiwi slices; sliced smoked turkey cold cuts and deli cheeses, eggs and bacon; rolls, breads, and croissants; a few different cereals and milk; whole fruit; small baguette sandwiches; a few different juices, coffee, and water; and nice jams and other condiments. The breakfast staff was pleasant and the decor, matching up with the rest of the hotel, was quite modern. They had some interesting modern music playing too, it was kind of techno-esque, but nothing was played loud enough to bother anyone. I didn't even notice it until halfway through my first breakfast. Most breakfasts included with hotel rooms in Italy seemed to be some breads, butter and jam, and coffee. This was the first and only that offered a heartier selection. The room was nicely decorated and we had a small balcony. The bathroom was above average for an Italian bathroom. Black tile with white fixtures.
