It had a full tub, which was a first, that had this odd half shower door on it. Other than a little water on the floor, it worked just fine. Good water pressure and all, nice detachable-type shower head. The toilet and bidet were rectangular but they worked the same as their oval counterparts. The bed was comfortable, a little more supple than some of the very firm (hard) mattresses in other hotels. Don't get me wrong, it couldn't ever be confused for saggy or too soft. Nice little minibar in the room with some five ounce glass bottle Coke and Sprite for four euros each. Everything in the hotel is pretty much brand new with a very modern decor. Interestingly enough, all pictures on one wall were put right next to each other in a big rectangle on the wall. It was very odd, but I ended up liking it. The hotel was great, friendly staff, can't beat the location unless you want to be able to walk to everything, and if you can spend the money, I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel; Loved their mini suite!”
Reviews.Author: Vtourist
Reviews.Content: We liked the Pulitzer Rome after our three night stay in Rome. Hotel is close to marconi station - 100 meter away by walking which made romaing the city possible. Area around it is not great though we didnt encounter any issue, except it is certainly lacks any attraction. Likes: Rooms are clean, new with touch of artistic taste. Bathroom is big /clean with excellent amenities (shower is prefect)- my wife complained that they didnt have a hair conditioner. Best part is their staff, young , well spoken italian folks(specially Laura) which was instrumental in updating us to a mini suite. Breakfast was good- nice selection and big room (Breakfast staff were abit rude though). Check in and out was quick and room service was good No internet and poor TV channels (few with only 2 English ones) were things we didnt expect from such a new hotel All in all, a good New hotel in Rome . Would come back again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel plunked down into not so nice area”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: This is a tough call because the hotel itself is nice, modern, new, decorated very well, all the things I love. However, you are far off the beaten path to go to Rome and the surroundings of the hotel are not the greatest. The walk back to the hotel from the Metro station at night is creepy as it is completely dark and the housing area nearby does not inspire confidence. We were two guys walking back and feeling uneasy, I can only imagine what a woman might have felt like. Actually, I might just advise a woman on her own not to stay at this hotel, I just would say it is not worth it for that reason alone. Once you are at the hotel, it is a very good experience. The rooms are nice, well designed and we even had a large balcony which was nice. There was also a gym which we used every day and appreciated. Breakfast was quite good too. If you find yourself there at dinner time, the hotel restaurant was a ghost town, probably as a result of the prices, but there is a great little neighborhood place nearby, Il Pepperocino or something like that. Again, the walk to get there was a little dodgy, but once you got there is was great, just locals and very fun and full of energy with good food. The staff, especially Laura, was very nice to us and she even let me use her laptop in the back for a minute or two to print something out, which was nice. It would be better for the hotel to have a computer for guests however. I'm very surprised that a hotel of this caliber does not. All in all, if you are a good traveler and can handle yourself well and don't mind making a trek to a hotel to get a good deal, I would recommend the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not really organised for business”
Reviews.Author: Outinthemiddaysun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of September 2008, whilst attending a congress at the Nuove di Fiera centre near the airport. It cost about 30 Euros to get there by cab from Fiumicino, and be sure to print out the address, as it's new and many cab drivers don't yet know the name. The hotel only opened a few months ago, and it still looks and feels new, with a high standard of fixures and fittings. The lobby is nice, the staff extremely helpful. They took in courier deliveries for us and stored everything in their offices for our arrival. Check in was a touch slow, but was friendly. The lifts are nice and quite fast. Rooms are nice - they have single rooms at reasonable prices, helpful for business travellers - as well as double and twin rooms. Some of the rooms have nice balconies. Air con works well. Everything very clean. Breakfast good - self service and loads of choice. The meeting room that we booked was excellent - nicely furnished and a good size. The food was good, and staff were helpful about bringing more drinks etc. However - the kitchens are only open until 11pm, and after that it's impossible to get any more drinks or snacks, not even water - we ended up raiding our room minibars for coke, water and crisps when our meeting went on late. Only one area where they really need to improve - internet and business facilities. The internet is advertised as being fast - it's NOT. It's extremely slow, so you can barely access hotmail, never mind download files or access virtual desktops. And they don't have a business centre, so no photocopier, no printer, no paper, no envelopes, no CD-Rs, nothing - you'll need to take everything you need with you. During normal hours, staff were helpful with providing sellotape and paperclips, but that's about it. Although I really liked it as a hotel, I'm not sure I'd stay again - the metro stop is 10 mins walk away, so you can get into the city fairly easily (or 15 euros by cab), but you feel really off the beaten track here, so it may not be ideal for tourists. The nearest ATM is a half hour walk away, or in the city. And without good internet, it's not really ideal for business travellers. And it's not especially close to the airports either, so I'm not really sure what clientele it's aiming at.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonhSP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It´s a very modern, new, well located hotel. The room is very spacious and very well decorated. The staff is really helpful, specially Laura. It was a pleasent surprise in our trip to Europe. If I return to Rome I´ll stay there again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jgbot
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulizer Rome is undoubtedly the best hotel i have ever stayed in ! we arrived at 11:00 am and asked if we could leave our bags some where, we where told (in perfect English) that our room was ready and we could checkin now ! brilliant ! then we went up to the room ! the room was beautiful looked like it was out of a magazine, leather sofa's Large LCD TV, big safe (big enough to fit my 15" MacBook pro in) mini bar and a amazing bathroom with all the trimmings (dressing gowns, slippers) and the best thing about the room ? the bed ! it was a extremely comfy queen size bed (not 2 single bed pushed together) all in all a excellent room ! the hotel staff where all very friendly and spoke perfect English breakfast was to a very high standard also ! the cocktail bar was also very modern and produced some brilliant cocktails ! i booked directy on there website and paid 99 euros for 1 night but this included two breakfasts and a bottle of prosecco delivered to the door in a bucket of ice on a silver tray ! extremely good value for money, the location is also very good its 2 minutes to the tube station and 15 mins door to door to termini station, my only complaint is the square toilet, but it served its purpose ! my message to the Hotel Pulitzer mangment is well done ! and could i have the same rate in a few year when i come back ?

Reviews.Title: “great location.”
Reviews.Author: sherriwill
Reviews.Content: On arrival, there was a minor problem with our "Last minute.com" booking. Last minute didn't "Confirm" our booking. The reception staff were initially surprised and the receptionist quickly rectified the situation by contacting Last minute. All of this was carried out very professionally. We were then upgraded to a junior suite. After touring Tuscany to book our wedding, we again, checked into this hotel, and were appointed a regular room. Rooms are very spacious, clean and well appointed. Great beds, and after a night touring Rome, there's no better sight than a crisp white cotton sheeted bed The staff are very courteous and the majority speak good English. The location may be outside Rome, however, the Metro runs through the Marconi Station which is around 200 metres from the hotel. Virtually next door, is an old world Italian shop / deli. The hours are limited, as it must be run by the oldest / friendliest couple in Italy. On checking out, the reception staff allowed us to use the hotels back office computer to check-in-online our return flights home. This was offered by the staff and was so appreciated by us. If we ever return to Rome to stay, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Airconditioning Bug!”
Reviews.Author: jgb613
Reviews.Content: So I read the reviews of this hotel and it looked good. We arrived on 12th May on their "special deal" of 3 nights or more and get a 5 % discount + sparkling water and fresh fruit on arrival. We checked into room 409 and the room was clean, nicely decorated, bathroom was nice. 1st Minor point, there was only one spare pillow, so needed to order some more, no biggy 2nd Minor point, no sparkling water or fresh fruit. This was duly requested and delivered within about 1 hour of arriving. 1st Major point. After relaxing in the room for about 1 hour, the temperature of the room did not seem to be decreasing, despite the airconditioning system being "on". We decided to enquire at the reception desk on our way out to dinner. we left at 6:30pm and informed them that we could not seem to get it working, could they have a look at it. Anyhow, we returned at about 11PM to find the room a near oven. I called to reception who said that we should wait fifteen minutes to see if it was switched off whilst we were out. I informed them it was on when we entered in and they sent someone up. After another 10 minutes and two people looking at it, I was then informed that they didnt know what was wrong, and they would "look into it". 20 minutes later, I headed downstairs to find out, only to be told it looked like it was broken....So it took them 5 HOURS to look into a problem. My wife who was pregnant of 6 months was not amused. The comment offered by the reception desk manager was "well you could open the window"....MMMmmmm not tempting since it was on a busy street. Anyway, after another 1/2 hour of waiting, we were moved into a twin bed room (as this was the only one available) and were informed we would be moved into a double room the next day. We agreed to this, only to find that the next day, the hotel was full....so they pushed our twin beds together instead....not comfortable to sleep between mattresses. Still other than this, the hotel is clean, staff are friendly, and service relatively good. Location is 300 metres from Marconi on the Linea B, which is great for travelling to and from rome and sightseeing. Also, you can catch the 170 from Termini to the front door practically, which runs to Midnight in case you miss the last train (like we did). Just avoid the dreaded Rm 409!

Reviews.Title: “Bello! Excellent hotel with boutique designer style”
Reviews.Author: Dublin TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! And the friendliest staff on earth - they were falling over themselves to help me and my Mum enjoy our stay there. Very similar to the Pulitzer, BCN (in many respects identical): Clean lines, minimalist, lcd screens, lovely showers (there could be a shelf for toiletries though - might have just been this room), nice art prints, white walls, dark wooden floors. Location is in EUR, the business district of Rome, and the hotel is just a few metres away from the Metro Station so it's very easy to get in and out of town - in fact, buses also go by the hotel which bring you straight into the Trastevere restaurant district. Given I normally stay in the Excelsior in Via Veneto, I'm a bit of a snob when it comes to Rome hotels (in fact my customer thought it was hilarious I was staying outside the centre) but boy, will I be back! Price was great too - definitely below market for Rome. I suspect there will be increases. Only gripe was wife and ADSL connections - they were still having teething problems and I had to use the modem via the telephone line (never pleasant). Still, believe it or not, the receptionist actually said I could use his computer if I wanted to for 10 mins or so - nice or what? Definitely going back. (PS Didn't check out the gym - do hope there is a treadmill there so manager if you are reading this, please make sure it's there when I get back!)

Reviews.Title: “Great & brand new”
Reviews.Author: melbtraveller_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in historical centre of Rome, but only a few meters away from the subway station that will take you everywhere. If you are looking for a high-end luxurious hotel without the price tag, look no further! The rooms are ultra modern and chique, the staff is great and really helpfull (front desk speak english and spanish as well), the breakfast was great with lots of fresh fruit and fresh coffee. My fave in Italy for what you pay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...”
Reviews.Author: LondonAna
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Pulitzer for 3 nights in the middle of February. The hotel was very nice, rooms were inmaculately clean and the staff was very polite and pleasant. The location is just fine, the underground station Marconi is only a couple of minutes down the road and just in front of the hotel there is a bus stop with regular buses which will take you direclty onto Termini Station. Please take my advise and use public transport, it's only a 20min tube ride into the city centre. Try not to rely on taxis, they can be very expensive and as a matter of fact we were robbed by the actual taxi driver that took us back to the hotel on a Saturday night, just outside the hotel (but that's another story!) In all, great hotel, very pleasant stay and definately recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lookydog
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel only opened in January. Overall in aesthetic you couldn't tell however staff's local knowledge is telling in the newness of the establishment. The hotel itself is lovely and the staff are very welcoming. The room (as most european rooms are) was small but had good use of space. The bathroom was lovely with a full bath and extremely clean. We also had a balcony which was shared with the next room but was lovely even though looking down onto a main road. The breakfast was nice and decent by european standards. The cleanliness of the hotel could not be faulted and was immaculate through out. There is a supermarket just round the corner which is cheap and across the road from the supermarket is a pizzaria which costs €3.50 for a 16 inch pizza. The metro is two minutes down the road which is great. The hotel itself is not in the main city so the metro is the way to go. Taxi rates varied wildly when we did get them so I would advise to buy a metro ticket which cost us €16 for seven days unlimited usage. Over all a lovely time but as I say the staff do need more loal knowledge on Rome itself but in saying that of there is something they don't know they will do their utmost to find out for you.
